page.title: 07My uncle's farm in Sparkwell
page.content: On May the 28th 1985 my Dad and I stayed on my Uncle Michael's farm for two days to help with the silaging. He gets up at 7.a.m.,has his breakfast then goes out on the farm. First of all he milks his 60 cows,that takes him until 10.a.m. Then he washes the parlour and puts the cows out into the field. Next he drives 4 miles to see his dry cows and heifers. When he gets back he moves the fence and goes for dinner. Whilst he has been doing all that his son has fed the calves and cleaned the yards. Then he and my Dad started silaging. After lunch uncle helped with the silaging until we stopped for tea. Then it was time for my uncle to milk the cows again. He finished them at 9.30.a.m. By the time he has washed up it is 10p.m. and the end of a long day. Paul Verran.
